meanings.definition: Cause severe and extensive damage or destruction to.
meanings.sent1: The hurricane was ravaging the small town, destroying homes and trees.
meanings.sent2: The wildfire was ravaging the forest, leaving behind a path of destruction.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was ravaging through the garbage cans in search of a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: The virus was ravaging the population, spreading rapidly and causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The tornado was ravaging the landscape, tearing everything in its path.

meanings.sent1: The vandal was ravaging the park, spray painting benches and walls.
meanings.sent2: The rebellious teenager was ravaging the school property, causing chaos in the hallways.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was ravaging the living room, chewing on shoes and pillows.
meanings.sent4: The invasive species was ravaging the ecosystem, disrupting the natural balance.
meanings.sent5: The rioters were ravaging the city streets, looting stores and setting fires.
